11 #e96565

Emotional Branding

It seems unnecessary to add the word “Emotional” before ”Branding” when every brand should be creating emotional connections with their customers. But the reality is that until social media, most companies didn’t even listen to customers. Interacting with your brand should give a customer the same feeling they get when they hear their favorite song. They buy things because of the promise of feeling better.

Make them feel better.

12 #e99d3a

Storytelling & Films

The challenge with websites is they are non-linear so they suck at storytelling. When a prospect touches your brand for the first time you want the experience to unfold with order. Nothing achieves that better than the power of storytelling via films.

We think that in our attention- deficit world, a short film is unsurpassed in getting people to care. Strong characters in a solid story is a classic vehicle for making connections.

13 #93b369

Creative Direction

Good creative direction is more strategy than design. We love the synergy that comes from understanding a spreadsheet and then accelerating business goals with the attractive nature of good creative design.

Nourish Creative can help name new products or companies and then package and promote them to a targeted and defined audience.

Our secret: we remember what it feels like to be a customer.

14 #7090ba

Still Photography

In an age when almost anyone can wield a powerful camera that can shoot stills and video, you’d think we’d be worried. We actually think it’s great that so many people are experiencing the joy of photography.

A well-worn phrase comes to mind… “An amateur can come back with a great shot, the professional must come back with a great shot.”
